docBody.head: BIRTH CONTROL LECTURES END

q.p: Margaret Sanger says she looks to the women of California to take the first steps that will place this country on the same basis with European countries in the matter of birth control.

She declared yesterday in her talk before the Oakland center of the California Civic League in Hotel Oakland that the women of California, with the power of suffrage, could bring about the repeal of the laws against the dissemination of information about birth control, and by so doing could set the pace for the whole country along this line.

docBody.p: "This is my last appearance here," said Mrs. Sanger. "I leave to-morrow for Portland, on my way to the East again. I shall return in October and I hope that by that time you women will have made decided progress toward getting the laws repealed that now forbid your physician to tell you the vital facts of life.

"When I return to California and find that California women have accomplished this I shall immediately begin the installation of scientifically conducted clinics, where this information can be given to the working women-in other words, to those who need it most and who find it hardest to obtain."
